results.title: Making a good impression (Captioned)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “Teenagers’ guide to the galaxy”.
Part of a series developed for young people aged 9-16 which deals with issues of communication skills, interpersonal skills, life skills and problem solving. “Making a good impression” discusses what is required to impress others, particularly when applying for a job. Includes hints and advice by teenagers and adults on appearance; manners and etiquette; respect for yourself and others; initiative; preparation; confidence. Features Colette Mann as Fay.

results.title: Making a decision in the family
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Balla, ONF | NFB and Julia Murphy
results.brief_description: Discussion film for adults on parental authority and teenagers. When a high-school girl declares her preference for going to a gathering of her own friends rather than to a family gathering, she runs headlong into her parent’s objections. It is their decision and not hers which is to abide. The result is a clash of wills. The question of what might have been a better approach is left with the film audience.

results.title: Making a car bumper
results.creator_credit: Brent Productions and Topical Film Company
results.brief_description: The making of a steel bumper by a machine press is used to illustrate the skill of the makers of press tools, the punch and the die, by means of which quantities of bumpers can be produced with a minimum of skilled labour. A vocational guidance film showing the skilled work of the tool maker in large-scale production engineering.

results.title: Making a canoe
results.creator_credit: Peter Halket, Maurice Dybeck and Explorer Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Canoecraft”.
Two boys, with the help of an adult instructor, make a slalom canoe from glass reinforced plastic. The processes involved are shown step by step. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Making a bark canoe (A)
results.creator_credit: Australian Institute of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Studies
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Alcheringa (A)”.
A detailed description of the processes involved in making a bark canoe. Includes the proper way to remove the heavy water-soaked bark, the steam heating to make it pliable to shape the stern and bow, and the way to sew the ends together.

results.title: Making a balanced aquarium
results.creator_credit: Plymouth Productions and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description: Two children make a balanced aquarium in a glass tank. They demonstrate the step-by-step procedures of collecting soil and river gravel, placing these and the water in the tank, gathering and planting pond weeds, and then obtaining fish and other water animals to complete their aquarium.

results.title: Making 'The Girl from Tomorrow'
results.brief_description: The making of “The Girl from Tomorrow” provides teachers of media with an example of how this exciting series was made. Interviews with the director, Kathy Mueller and the producer, Noel Price are included along with technical information on just how the special effects were achieved.
